channel.title: Permit Questions
channel.description: So, I turned 16 on Sunday and I just went to get my permit today. I passed, but I was wondering If any of you remeber some of the questions on it. Mainly extremely stupid ones. The stupidest one I had to answer was, "What color is a stop sign?". I just wanted to see other stupid questions on the tests.

item.title: Permit Questions
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Everyone who answered Coon’s question is wrong. It’s rhetorical, as the question is worded wrong.

IF the dog is chasing after you, that clearly means it is behind you, taveling the same direction as you.

A; clearly wouldn’t work, as it’d let the dog catch you easier.
B; clearly wouldn’t work, unless driving in reverse, which I doubt any motorcycle has the ability to do so.
C; clearly wouldn’t work, as if you turned around, you’d be facing the dog, and then drive towards it.
D; clearly wouldn’t work, as you let the dog catch up, then fall back, then repeat. Sort of like tag, etc.

I believe the question should be the dog is running towards you.

/sarcasm

@topic; I’m almost 16 and don’t even have my permit, :P[/quote]
They mean it like, its running threw the yard to out infront of you. Not already behind you

Read full topic

item.title: Permit Questions
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

It’s A. Most house/yard dogs aren’t necessarily aggressive if you assert the “alpha dog” position. If you stop, the dog has a tendency to become docile if you assert the position.

Read full topic

item.title: Permit Questions
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

Just throwing another one out there. When do you need your license?

Some of the people in the registry are ridiculous. There was a guy in the room with me and he didn’t speak good English. On the door before you enter the room it says in bold, underlined, and large font, [size=14pt]No Talking[/size]. He starts talking to me because he’s confused about his test. He gets up and leaves to talk to someone at the desk (I think they failed him). People are stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Permit Questions
item.dc:creator: @Mack_n_cheese Mack n cheese
item.description:
@Mack_n_cheese wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Everyone who answered Coon’s question is wrong. It’s rhetorical, as the question is worded wrong.

IF the dog is chasing after you, that clearly means it is behind you, taveling the same direction as you.

A; clearly wouldn’t work, as it’d let the dog catch you easier.
B; clearly wouldn’t work, unless driving in reverse, which I doubt any motorcycle has the ability to do so.
C; clearly wouldn’t work, as if you turned around, you’d be facing the dog, and then drive towards it.
D; clearly wouldn’t work, as you let the dog catch up, then fall back, then repeat. Sort of like tag, etc.

I believe the question should be the dog is running towards you.

/sarcasm

@topic; I’m almost 16 and don’t even have my permit, :P[/quote]so what’s the point of putting it in a driving test?

if you can’t solve this rhetorical question, you obviously can’t drive XD

Read full topic

item.title: Permit Questions
item.dc:creator: @outrageouscape outrageouscape
item.description:
@outrageouscape wrote:

I thought it was B -.-

I got it first

item.title: Permit Questions
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:7, topic:385422”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=481178.msg3523500#msg3523500 date=1299606194]
Here is one for my motorcycle permit.

When a dog is running after you, do you:
A:Stop and wait until it looses intrest.
B:Speed up and run it over.
C:Turn around and go a different way
D:Slow down, and quickly speed up when close to the dog.

I bet 90% of u get it wrong.
[/quote]
D of curz![/quote]
Yup, first time I read it I was like ‘fucking neighbors r gonna kill me’

Read full topic
